definitions.definition: The physical confine of a river or slough, consisting of a bed and banks.
definitions.example: The water coming out of the waterwheel created a standing wave in the channel.

definitions.definition: The natural or man-made deeper course through a reef, bar, bay, or any shallow body of water.
definitions.example: A channel was dredged to allow ocean-going vessels to reach the city.

definitions.definition: The navigable part of a river.
definitions.example: We were careful to keep our boat in the channel.

definitions.definition: A narrow body of water between two land masses.
definitions.example: The English Channel lies between France and England.

definitions.definition: Something through which another thing passes; a means of conveying or transmitting.
definitions.example: The news was conveyed to us by different channels.

definitions.definition: A gutter; a groove, as in a fluted column.
A connection between initiating and terminating nodes of a circuit.
definitions.example: The guard-rail provided the channel between the downed wire and the tree.

definitions.definition: The narrow conducting portion of a MOSFET transistor.
(communication) The part that connects a data source to a data sink.
(communication) A path for conveying electrical or electromagnetic signals, usually distinguished from other parallel paths.
definitions.example: We are using one of the 24 channels.

definitions.definition: (communication) A single path provided by a transmission medium via physical separation, such as by multipair cable.
definitions.example: The channel is created by bonding the signals from these four pairs.

definitions.definition: (communication) A single path provided by a transmission medium via spectral or protocol separation, such as by frequency or time-division multiplexing.
definitions.example: Their call is being carried on channel 6 of the T-1 line.

definitions.definition: A specific radio frequency or band of frequencies, usually in conjunction with a predetermined letter, number, or codeword, and allocated by international agreement.
definitions.example: KNDD is the channel at 107.7 MHz in Seattle.

definitions.definition: A specific radio frequency or band of frequencies used for transmitting television.
definitions.example: NBC is on channel 11 in San Jose.

definitions.definition: (storage) The portion of a storage medium, such as a track or a band, that is accessible to a given reading or writing station or head.
definitions.example: This chip in this disk drive is the channel device.

definitions.definition: (technic) The way in a turbine pump where the pressure is built up.
definitions.example: The liquid is pressurized in the lateral channel.

definitions.definition: A distribution channel
A particular area for conversations on an IRC network, analogous to a chat room and often dedicated to a specific topic.
An obsolete means of delivering up-to-date Internet content.
A psychic or medium who temporarily takes on the personality of somebody else.
To make or cut a channel or groove in.
To direct or guide along a desired course.
definitions.example: We will channel the traffic to the left with these cones.

definitions.definition: (of a spirit, as of a dead person) To serve as a medium for.
definitions.example: She was channeling the spirit of her late husband, Seth.

definitions.definition: To follow as a model, especially in a performance.
definitions.example: He was trying to channel President Reagan, but the audience wasn't buying it.

definitions.definition: The wale of a sailing ship which projects beyond the gunwale and to which the shrouds attach via the chains. One of the flat ledges of heavy plank bolted edgewise to the outside of a vessel, to increase the spread of the shrouds and carry them clear of the bulwarks.
Formal lines of command and procedure.
definitions.example: I'd love to be able to help you, but you'll have put that request through channels.
